10:33 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: still there? I was curious why comment preview is not enabled for guests? If guests can post comment then they should be able to preview IMO. Is there any security problem?  
10:34 <+mflorea> comments.js has this test in addPreview:  
10:34 <+mflorea> if (!form || !XWiki.hasEdit) {  
10:34 <+mflorea>   return;  
10:34 <+mflorea> }  
10:35 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <+mflorea> hmm, "Failed to generate preview: Unauthorized"  
10:37 <+mflorea> I suppose it's because preview action requires login

11:01 <silviar> Hi! I'm trying to attach some images to this page http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing and the "Add another file" link is missing from the "Attachments" tab. Is this a known issue?  
11:01 <+sburjan> Hello everybody. It seems we have an issue with xwiki.org main page. On chrome 17 I am unable to use the horizontal menu because when I want to hover over a sub-menu item, the menu disappears. Can someone reproduce this ?  
11:03 <silviar> Nevermind. I attached one file and the link seems to be back. Sorry for the noise.

16:05 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
16:13 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what's the best/safest way to tell if a XWikiDocument instance is the default translation or not. In other words, if I give you a XWikiDocument instacen, how do you get the objects, knowing that objects are saved only on the default translation.  
16:14 <@sdumitriu> There's an isTranslation() method  
16:14 <+mflorea> hmm  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> No, it's getTranslation() and it should return 0 for the default document  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> (on XWikiDocument only, not on api.Document)  
16:17 <+mflorea> I missed it, translation field is stored in db afaik, so it should be safe to use it  
16:17 <+mflorea> thanks  
16:30 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: my problem is that SheetManager gets a DocumentModelBridge and looks for objects to determine the sheet. I'm hesitating between modifying the SheetManager to test if the given doc is a translation and leave this to the responsibility of the caller, e.g. DocumentSheetDisplayer (which gets the sheet and applies it). I'm more for the later.

17:52 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: there are 3 unit tests failing in csrf module that might have to do with your last commits http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-csrf/1599/testReport/  
17:53 <+tmortagne> mflorea: did not seen, looking  
17:53 <+tmortagne> I was working on it actually, did not remember I pushed it  
17:53 <@sdumitriu> No, looks like something vmassol caused with his changes to logger injection  
17:54 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ok (sorry then, will ping vmassol)  
17:54 <vmassol> checking
